moon.name: Moon
moon.description: Earth's only natural satellite, the Moon affects tides and has been the only celestial body visited by humans.

phobos.name: Phobos
phobos.description: Phobos is the larger and closer of Mars' two moons, with a decaying orbit.

deimos.name: Deimos
deimos.description: Deimos is the smaller of Mars’ two moons and has a smooth surface due to regolith.

io.name: Io
io.description: One of Jupiter's moons, Io is the most volcanically active body in the Solar System.

europa.name: Europa
europa.description: Europa is an icy moon of Jupiter that may harbor a subsurface ocean.

genymede.name: Ganymede
genymede.description: Ganymede is the largest moon in the Solar System and has a magnetic field.

callisto.name: Callisto
callisto.description: Callisto is heavily cratered and is the third-largest moon in the Solar System.

titan.name: Titan
titan.description: Titan is Saturn’s largest moon and has a thick atmosphere with lakes of methane.

enceladus.name: Enceladus
enceladus.description: Enceladus is a small, icy moon of Saturn with water-ice geysers.

miranda.name: Miranda
miranda.description: Miranda is one of Uranus' moons known for its extreme and varied terrain.

triton.name: Triton
triton.description: Triton is Neptune’s largest moon and orbits in the opposite direction of the planet’s rotation.
